HubSpot Advanced Forms, Switch Button and custom style
----------------------------------------------------
Hi All,
 I am looking for a way to style HubSpot forms more accurately.
Specifically, I want to implement a form like Correctiv did in this example:
<https://correctiv.org/newsletter/>
The switch buttons, but also the texts underneath are especially exciting.
In the example, the whole thing was implemented with MailChimp, as can be seen in the HTML code, with a little custom CSS.
BUT how can I implement something like this in HubSpot?
I have already tried it with HubSpot Custom Modules. But not all our customers use the HubSpot CMS.
I am curious about your suggestions!

Hey Partners. I am wondering if it is possible to add a delay of about 3-5 seconds to a form submission when the “submit” button is clicked. The form is set to re-direct to the same page it is on, only to then show the “unlocked” version of the page using HubSpot’s smart content feature to control who can access the video on the page. I was wondering what exactly the function would be to add this delay to the form, if possible. Thanks!

I'd try getting rid of the redirect action on the form and instead show an inline message like "loading" and then using a global form event listener to, on successful formSubmit, execute a setTimeout function to refresh the page after your predefined delay.
<@U021P3RAVUG> I can help you doing that if you need? Hope everything is going well for you in the great white north! :wink:
Hi! How are you? Would love to hear your workaround!!
It involves some JavaScript .. but it's totally doable.
Oh.. um . Not really. It's a function that is only available via the embed code and is accessed via JS
I'm mean I've done things like this many times but it has been years since I've stalled a form..
